tool.name: OTB.LocalStatisticExtraction
tool.description: Computes local statistical moments on every pixel in the selected channel of the input image
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayin False output_data_out $output_data_out name OTB.LocalStatisticExtraction in $in channel $channel ram $ram radius $radius out $out prefer $prefer response $response outputType_out $OutputSection_out.outputType_out transmissionMode_out $OutputSection_out.transmissionMode_out

param.name: in
param.label: The input image to compute the features on.
param.help: The input image to compute the features on. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: jpeg, tiff, png

param.name: out
param.label: Output image containing the local statistical moments.
param.help: Output image containing the local statistical moments.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_out
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_out
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: This application computes the 4 local statistical moments on every pixel in the selected channel of the input image, over a specified neighborhood. The output image is multi band with one statistical moment (feature) per band. Thus, the 4 output features are the Mean, the Variance, the Skewness and the Kurtosis. They are provided in this exact order in the output image.
